wintaassefa1: ❤ You're an eloquent speaker and writing, Chimamanda. But there's another definition of love which kidnapped my heart: If I give all my possessions to feed the poor, and if I surrender my body to be burned, but do not have love, it does me no good at all. Love endures with patience and serenity, love is kind and thoughtful, and is not jealous or envious; love does not brag and is not proud or arrogant. It is not rude; it is not self-seeking, it is not provoked [nor overly sensitive and easily angered]; it does not take into account a wrong endured. It does not rejoice at injustice, but rejoices with the truth [when right and truth prevail]. amoiseminet: Today I celebrate The right to work, The right to travel, The right to physical integrity. Today I celebrate The women Before me Who fought for women’s rights. Their rights then Are mine now, Irrevocably. They were called witches, They were called bitches, They were called feminists. Today I celebrate The right to have a bank account, The right to dress as I wish, The right to make my voice heard, The right to stand on my own. My rights are my heritage And my inheritance to pass on. Today I celebrate My right to write, My right to rest, My right to exercise, My right to have me-time, My right to be me, My right to be happy, Today I celebrate all women’s rights Present and to come. Assamala, 8 March 2019. From Brazzaville, Congo.

solomon_buchi: Dear woman, I know you’ve been socialized to be modest with your dreams, to be timid, and not vocal. You’ve been socialized to need men to validate your essence, but that is stopping this very moment. You have to tap into the ocean of your inner power; the limitless version of you that cannot be tamed by the society. You have to discover the YOU that you are without seeking societal validation. There’s a lot you can be without a man. You have to push to get to the table, to offer your value. Raise your voice, speak and don’t stumble. Oh yes, they will label you names like ‘slutty’ ‘arrogant’ but this is an indicator of the rising of a woman. Their biggest fear is that you’d ever realize your worth, and what you truly deserve. Dear woman, you are more. So much more. Happy International Women’s Day
